alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus; Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 4:10AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by overnight rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Mecklenburg and western Cabarrus Counties in North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Mallard Creek may be flooding the PNC Music Pavilion parking lots and other low-lying areas along Pavilion Boulevard. Portions of the Mallard Creek Greenway are likely flooded, particularly near North Tryon Street and East Mallard Creek Church Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 AM EST, Minor flooding is already occurring on Mallard Creek. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell overnight. - Mallard Creek at Pavilion Blvd is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. A lull in rainfall should limit further rises, but high water will continue to move downstream through the morning. Minor flooding may occur on the Rocky River and Irish Buffalo Creek by late morning or early afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeast Charlotte, West Concord, Harrisburg, University City, Reedy Creek Park, Charlotte Motor Speedway, Hidden Valley and Croft. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
